headline: News quiz: Test your knowledge of this week in Berkeley news
subhead: Did you follow the news in Berkeley this week, [dates]? To take our quiz, choose an answer, and the correct response will appear after you click.

sections.question: Sociology is the study of…?
sections.explanation: Sociology is in fact the study of all of the above. We’re not only looking at individual people, but also how they interact with others, and how institutions shape their lives.

sections.question: Which theory believes that people in society battle over scarce resources like money, power, and prestige?
sections.explanation: By definition, conflict theory, with a Macro level of analysis, focuses on competition for scarce resources. This theory is closely related with theorists such as Karl Marx.

sections.question: The Hawthorne effect explains how human behavior is altered when being watched.
sections.explanation: The Hawthorne effect (also referred to as the observer effect) is a type of reactivity in which individuals modify an aspect of their behavior in response to their awareness of being observed.

sections.question: Which theory believes that society is made up of many building blocks that all play a part in maintaining stability?
sections.explanation: Structural functionalism, or simply functionalism, is "a framework for building theory that sees society as a complex system whose parts work together to promote solidarity and stability".

sections.question: Social stratification is…?
sections.option1: A process in which people are divided into groups reflecting their relative wealth and prestige
sections.option2: A system in which people are divided into layers reflecting their relative wealth, power, and prestige
sections.option3: A process in which the government divides people into layers according to their financial need
sections.option4: A system in which the more superior class of persons opposes those of a lower class
sections.explanation: Social stratification is a kind of social differentiation whereby a society groups people into socioeconomic strata, based upon their occupation and income, wealth and social status, or derived power (social and political). As such, stratification is the relative social position of persons within a social group, category, geographic region, or social unit.
